attributes.action: Deport violent immigrant criminals at the end of there jail sentence no appeal.
attributes.additional_details: It is a governments first job to keep everybody safe. The government at this time has a massive majority in parliament and so if it has the will can keep us safe.  By deporting any violent immigrant after serving there sentence the reoffending rate will be zero, by having no appeal to this process the public will be reassured and the criminals will think twice before committing violence on our streets. When deported they should be advised they face a min jail term of 10 yrs on illegal re-entry.
attributes.background: Any immigrant found guilty of committing any violent crime where they are sentenced to 6 months or more in prison to be deported when there time expires.  This should be mandatory and without any appeal process.

rejection.details:
The Home Secretary must already make a deportation order in respect of a foreign criminal unless certain exceptions apply (e.g. where deportation would contravene the UK’s obligations under the Refugee and Human Rights Conventions).

You can find out more here: https://commonslibrary.parliament.uk/research-briefings/cbp-8062/
